reviews.text: I stayed there for one week in July. I chose it because the conference I was attending was held there, so it is out of convenience. My initial reaction after check-in was that of shock -- it was not like any hotel I stayed in, or any motel, for that matter! It was like a student dorm from back in the 1970's in the soviet block -- in fact this was what it was. However, after a week of stay, I must say that my experience was not too bad. It's clean, functional (except for the Internet), and since I only paid about $42/day including breakfast, it is what I should expect.
reviews.title: Not so bad after the initial shock

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest problem is the Internet. One can only get free wifi in the hotel lobby, and it was painfully slow! No Internet in the room, period! So don't rely on getting anything done over the Internet.
reviews.title: ... we liked it!

reviews.text: Bring your own soap and shampoo. These are not provided by the hotel.
reviews.title: sovijet style building, room and service was good

reviews.text: Bathroom and toilet are very basic -- I mean they were for a student dorm back in the 70's. Don't expect anything more.
reviews.title: In fact, it's not so bad)

reviews.text: Breakfast was again very basic but sufficient -- cereal, tea/coffee, cold cuts, cheese, pate, boiled sausages, bread and milk, and apples. They do provide juices, but they taste so artificial that I opted for plain water.
reviews.title: Decent for the Price
